Absoloutly fantastic. These games have so much characther and this latest iteration does not dissapoint. 

I found the gameplay and shooting sequences on this latest version to be the smoothest to date. And the storyline, like the two previous bioschock games, is original and all it's own.

Looks beautiful on a good rig as well. Money well spent.
Отличная игрушка. Огорчили одинаковые персонажи в окружении. Всё-таки не старая игра, могли бы наплодить поразнообразнее... И концовки не хватает истинно Bioshock-овой, с разными вариантами:)
Incredible game.  A must have for anyone who likes the Bioshock franchise, a good, unique storyline, or single player first person shooters.
The graphics are awesome and it has lots of replay value.

Потрясающе,тут по-другому и не скажешь,такие эмоции после каждого прохождения этого шедевра!

Изначально по роликам когда только увидел геймплей игры присутствовал скептицизм и показалось слишком уж отошли от первых Биошоков с их неповторимой атмосферой города под водой,а тут на тебе,герой порхает в облаках в прямом смысле этого слова.Не поверите сами,пока не увидите город в воздухе,под названием Колумбия,удивит любого с различной фантазией,здесь каждая локация заставляет остановиться на миг и насладиться небесными красотами этих строений.А сюжетная составляющая однозначно побила своих предшественников,закрутили лихо и наврятли кто-то ожидал такой развязки.При этом взяла лучшее и от них,магические энергетики,с их помощью убийство превращается в искусство во всех частях этой удивительной игры.Возможно многим первые биошоки и не так понравились своей мрачностью,но инфинити не оставит равнодушным уж точно любого,только начнешь играть,потом уже тяжело будет оторваться пока не увидишь финальные титры;)

Элизабет-обычное женское имя для всех,но кто прошел эту игру,уже относиться особенно,уж она заставит ваше сердце стучать быстрее и сочувствовать этой никогда неунывающей девушке в её не легкой судьбе,а вы уж исполните главную роль...можно сказать благодаря ей игра обрела своего ангела!

"Как думаешь...Можно искупить все то,мы сделали?
Искупить?Не вижу смысла.
Букер...Ты боишься Бога?
Нет.Но тебя-боюсь. "

Моя оценка 9,9 из 10

P.S.-Ах да это еще лучший шутер уходящего года,сенсационно в какой-то мере,но нужно признать заслуженно,так что эту игру пропускать ни в коем случае нельзя,никому!

FPS อีกเกมหนึ่งที่แนะนำ
ไม่แค่แค่วันๆแต่เดินยิงไปเท่านั้น...เกมนี้ยังมีเนื้อเรื่องที่เข้มข้น จิกกัดประวัติศาสตร์และสังคมในปัจจุบันของอเมริกา
ในเกมนี้คุณได้รับมอบหมายให้ไปเมืองลอยฟ้า Columbia ที่ที่เอาประวัติศาสตร์อเมริกันมาเป็นศาสนา 
ในตอนแรกเมืองก็ดูสวยงามปรกติ เรียบร้อย แต่ในความเรียบร้อยนั้นก็มีความมืดมนแฝงอยู่ คุณจะค่อยๆเห็นมันไปเรื่อยตลอดการ
เดินในColumbiaตอนแรกๆถึงตอนจบ ส่วนElizabeth เด็กหญิงที่คุณได้รับมอบหมายให้ช่วยออกจากเมืองColumbiaนั้นเป็น
ตัวละครที่โดดเด่นที่สุดเท่าที่เคยเห็นมา เธอไม่ใช่ตัวถ่วงของเรา เธอจะช่วยเราตลอดการเดินทางออกจากColumbia 
และแอนิเมชั่น เสียงพากษ์ และหน้าตาของเธอ รวมกันแสดงอารมณ์ความรู้สึกของElizabethต่อเหตุการ์ณต่างๆในเกมได้อย่างไร้ที่ติ
อีกสิ่งหนึ่งที่ยอดเยี่ยมคือรายละเอียดต่างๆในเกม โปสเตอร์ข้างถนน เสียงวิทยุต่างๆ ผู้คนตามท้องถนน ก็สามารถเล่าเรื่องได้เหมือนกัน
แนะนำว่าอย่าวิ่งยิงอย่างเดียวให้สำรวจรอบๆแมพคุณจะเห็นอะไรต่างที่ช่วยให้คุณเข้าถึงเนื่อเรื่องได้
แต่เกมก็มีข้อเสียตรงที่ การยิงปืนไม่มันค่อยสนุกเอาซะเลย ซ้ำไปซ้ำมาไม่ค่อยท้าทายเท่าไรเมื่อเทียบกับ ภาคก่อน พลังเวทมนตร์ก็ไม่ค่อยใส่อะไรใหม่ๆเลย ศัตรูAIก็ไม่ค่อยดูฉลาดเท่าไร ความน่ากลัวเหมือน1-2ก็ไม่ค่อยมีเลย....
สรุปถ้าคุณสามารถเข้าถึงเนื้อเรื่องได้ก็แนะนำไปเลย
8/10

As overhyped as this game went through the media I can very well understand people complaining about letting their hopes down and so on. But for me, playing this game after not listening or watching any kind of gameplay and story-related news or reviews, its just a very good game. When you are searching mistakes of course you will find them, like in every other game, but if you just sink into the story and the world you will have a great time. Playing this game was really a very fun and emotional ride.
With todays standards of developing a game there is nearly nothing you could have done better in this game. On the other hand there is a lot of wasted potential, which would have made this game an all time classics. Still it is for sure a game you should have played.

Wow. 
I mean, wow.

Just, wow, I cant say a thing about this game. 
Simply, 


Wow.

Well...

First I would like to say that I avoided this game on purpose. I was afraid it would turn out to be just another Bioshock (Big Daddy, Big Sis, now what?). I also thought that the huge values of ammo everywhere I read about would just make this game even more dumb and boring then the previous ones. I'm glad it didn't come to that (there are some place in story where you have to play sort of efficiently). 

So I'm pretty pleased with this game. In a point of a view, this game is still a Bioshock. The approach, "lore", guns, vigor (or "magic" if you prefer :) ), everything has the same feel. The one thing that really surprised me was the story - I haven't felt like this in previous Bioshocks (the stories there felt like something sewed up on last minute to get the "shooter" some sence). Also the ending is quite touching (nothing original really, but i wasn't expecting that... still you have that feeling you know what might be coming, but you're not sure until it does, so it's a "good feelin"). 
There're some bugs yes, but nothing gamebreaking (got stucked 1 time in scripted event, but the checkpoint restart helped). 
So yes, I liked this game and I do recommend it.

This game is visually excellent. One of the best i've seen. However this is by far it's strongest point. The gameplay is soso and the story also soso (it's a bit too fantasy for me) I must say the game didn't seem very innovative at all or unique as far as gameplay went. Hugely overrated in my opinion. The fact that it got a 94 on metacritic baffles me. That kind of score gives the impression that the game is basically going to rock your socks off. Just didn't happen for me. I litterally felt i over paid for this game when  i bought it about 6 months after it's release for 75 percent off or more. It just didn't do it for me. Like another reviewer said it starts off really strong for about the first 15 min. With all it's visual awesomeness and Imersion. However almost imediately after the fighting starts it quickly reveals the gameplay to be very primitive. After having played through the whole game i realized i hardly ever even used the vigors which really didn't even add any fun to the game. Just a necessity sometimes if you're playing on hard and there's a group of enemies all shooting at you. All the vigors are basically stuns. Crows, swarms enemies with crows and they flail around like being swarmed with bees for a couple seconds. Bronco Bounces them up if i recall correctly. You have some electrical shock thing that stuns them. I mean almost all of them basically functioned the same way just a different theme and some are more effective than others. I found that first one you get with the cartoon picture of a devil to be completely useless other than when you first get it. Man i could just go on and on about things that weren't very well designed as far as gameplay is concerned. The fact that you can only carry two weapons with very limited ammo seems well really fucking stupid if you spent all your money upgrading the weapons you think are best then run out and have to pick up a really shitty weapon and just unload it on one of the weaker enemies faces only to find he's STILL NOT DEAD GOTTA RELOAD AND SHOOT HIM SOME MORE IN THE FACE. Seriously any and every COD or BF game that i've played and i've playe d most of them was more fun than this game. Yet i don't think there has been a single COD or BF that has been rated this high. So i have to conclude that this game gave all the critics boners just because it's bioshock and it looks pretty and they liked the story whch is kinda stupid. *SPOILER ALERT* +_[[[Mr dewit is Comstock who travels back in time to steal his own daughter...]]]_+ Man that's fucking stupid writing in my opinion. One of those really dumb parodoxes. Really any time a story has time traveling to the past i don't know how anyone can take it seriously especially when they travel to a time where they not only existed but they interact with themselves. So just let me say again this game is hugley overrated. It should have gotten a 70 something.
Sehr geniales Spiel, dichte Story, sollte man gespielt haben.

Bioshock Infinite is truly one of the best bits of storytelling I have seen in any form of media. The voice acting, art direction, the gameplay, and the music all come together to make what is a pleasure to behold. If you haven't played this game, do so. It's a must play for anyone, no matter whether or not you have ever played a Bioshock game or not.

8.5/10 game. 

Visually stunning,captivating and creative.
It was definitely a huge risk for the developers to actually bring bioshock out of the waters and into the sky. This definitely surprised me as a bioshock fan. Transiting from Rapture into the skycities of Columbia was definitely a good one. Columbia greats you with a pleasent introduction with many visual candies. The game is authentic to the age of patriotism- in simple words, they nailed patriotism correctly. 
Bioshock definitely has: 
Good Story ending that feels satisfying and amazing skyline rides.
Good introduction and story that leads you on.
However what's stopping this game to get a 10/10 is because there were simply a lack of guns. Some of the guns feels weak in the later game and it is just not feasible to carry it with you especially in huge fights.
The equipment cards you get weren't all that useful at all in fact there were only 4-6 that are actually useful for the players
Some important plot details should be integrated within the story as well however, they are left lying around in the game as collectables. 
Overall, Bioshock Infinite is a visually captivating game with a satisfying story to tell.
I would recommend this game for people who are fans of bioshock

Easily my favorite game of the year. Its beautiful, unique and wholly engaging. It's fantastical and grounded at the same time and a great easter egg hunt. And I promise you will never figure out the ending before finishing the game (unless you're a spoilersport). I have a pretty heavy rig so I can run smoothly regardless of my settings, but for people with less graphics capable hardware, there are some excellent tweak guides on the interwebs that will get you running smoother than a sniper round through a Handyman heart.

There are a lot of positive reviews for this game, which was initially what compelled me to purcahse it upon release. It was praised for its "excellent story" and immersive qualities. While it does have a decently gripping plot, Bioshock Infinite suffers from lack of gameplay quality. Enough so that I would not recommend this game to most players.

Bioshock Infinite holds a scary resemblence to Assassin's Creed (the first one) not in the sense that the setting or story are the same, but both have a great story and terrible gameplay. Like in Assassin's Creed, Bioshock Infinite has you doing the same things in the same scenarios over and over again while trying to switch it up by adding new elements to the same system. This repetitive style of development is completely transparent after your first handful of encounters and while not even halfway through the game, you can tell there is no end in sight to the repetition. In order to get through the plot, one has to hack and slash one's way through the dull gameplay; an uphill battle from which I chose to retreat from after about a third of the way into the game.

I applaud both Bioshock Infinite and Assassin's Creed for their efforts in storytelling, as it's a quality that is severely lacking in the video game industry and rarely explored. The Assassin's Creed team learned from their mistakes and hit a homerun with their second installment, Assassin's Creed II. Hopefully the Bioshock team will also learn from theirs and create a game that can tell a riveting tale as well as engage the player. However, Bioshock Infinite simply does not cut it.

It's a great game. Some fans of the previous Bioshocks might be a bit put of because the system and setting of the game are a bit different, and it's kind of non-canon even though there are references here and there. They added a shield system and got rid of those syringes for healing, and there are now upgrading stations for health, mana or shields hidden throughout. There are a few other gameplay changes, essentially simplifying and streamlining everything. Some people might view these as dumbing it down and succumbing to popular conventions, but I thought it was actually a welcome change. The story is absolutely mind blowing, but I've noticed that at least some of the fan base is divided on the ending. I thought it was brilliant, albeit really tough to follow if you weren't really on the ball with studying backstory throughout and whatnot. If you are willing to invest in the story, it will reward you. That aside, Elizabeth, your sidekick and companion throughout the game, is very real and I genuinely came to enjoy her company. She's one of the most relatable and enjoyable characters I've seen in games in a good while. A word on Columbia, the setting of the game; I absolutely LOVE it. I love designs from in and around that era, and I enjoy the departure from the gritty, dark atmosphere of Rapture. Despite its surface cheeriness, it belies a city governed with corruption and a storm of revolution brewing. I say definitely pick this game up, it will be worth your while whether or not you liked the previous two.

This game has one of the richest worlds I have ever seen in any game.  I have probably sunk more time into just wandering around the city than focusing on the acctual story.  The story is also extremely imoresive with many trwists and turns. Along this journey you are also accompanied by an amzing AI companion.  Whist in game she seems almost like dipenser she has exceptional dialouge with the main character.  The gamplay could have addapted a little more from the orriginal game.  The additions of the sky hook adds a very nice feel to the overall feel of the world but the weapon upgrades fall a bit short from th orginal with very generic options like damage or accuaracy increases for every gun.  This is all made up though by the adition of gear.  This gear adds extra inserntive to find better gear becuase their unique traits.  This games ending also warrants it's own recongnition for it made my head spin. Only after a couple of hours of reasearch in theorectical physics did I fully understand what had just happened.  This game does come with its fair share of flaws but they are most definitly overshadowed by an amazing world that you will sink hours into 9.5/10.

Mich hat das Spiel schon begeistert, als ich es mir als Let's Play bei GameTube angesehen habe. Die Grafik wirkt wie ein gezeichnetes Bild, welches man durch Bewegung des Gamepads oder der Maus/Tastatur in einem immer neuen Winkel betrachten kann. Die Story ist vielschichtig und motiviert zum mehrmaligen durchspielen. Ich habe dabei immer wieder neue Dinge gesehen und zumindest 2x sollte man es spielen, nachdem man die Auflösung gesehen hat, da es unzählige Anspielungen während des Spiels gibt. Ton und Steuerung sind wie erwartet gut und es macht Spaß sich durch die abgrenzte, aber denoch durchaus offene Welt (es gibt durchaus Möglichkeiten etwas abseits der Wege zu entdecken) zu bewegen und da ich mit Gamepad spiele, kann ich nur die Steuerung damit beurteilen. Sie funktioniert wunderbar und ohne Zielhilfe kommt man gut zurecht. Ich sitze einfach nicht gern so nah vor dem Bildschirm und grade dieses Spiel hat Momente und Orte, wo ich mich gern zurücklehne und das gesehene einfach genieße. Natürlich ist es schade, dass es weder ein richtiges Rollenspiel noch ein richtiger Ego-Shooter ist, aber bei beiden Genres habe ich in den letzten 21 Jahren genug Mist gespielt, um heute sagen zu können, Bioshock Infinite mag ich .. und ich werde es immer wieder mal spielen.

I find the inability to carry healthpacks and salt annoying, and the ammo capacity for the two weapons I can carry never seems to last even a fraction of the challenging fights.  This forces too many mid fight scavenger hunts for my taste.  I prefer exploring levels and taking the time to stockpile necessary gear when I am not being gunned down.

This game has some of best developed and most enjoyable characters that I have seen in a long time.  The story really drew me in and made me feel for the characters in the game.  One of the best story-driven games I've played.

Perhaps the greatest FPS with a story ever. If you liked the first Bioshock, you can skip straight to this one.  Columbia, the City in the Sky is an awe-inspiring spectacle of a setting, and it has parallels with its citizens as well as the city itself with the original game's Rapture.  A must play for fans of Bioshock. 5/5

BioShock Infinite – довершений цілісний та яскравий витвір, немов картина художника:
Безмежно красива - блискучий дизайн і надзвичайна скрупульозність в деталях світу Columbia. Від місцевих пейзажів подеколи перехоплює дух, так і завмираєш на мить… милуєшся і думаєш – ось так би виглядав рай земний. Музика гармонійно доповнює дійство на екрані, вона підносить BioShock на високий культурний рівень.
Неосяжно глибока - в голові паморочиться від сюжетних поворотів, від морально-етичних, філософських, релігійних, психологічних, наукових посилів авторів. Головні персонажі справжні, живі, цікаві. Елізабет – це окремий Всесвіт, від якого не відірвати погляд… який зачаровує.
BioShock Infinite цікава не лише з естетичної точки зору (не була б вона грою) - ґеймплей не дозволить вам сумувати, оскільки він різноманітний, динамічний, завжди варіативний, з дещицею додаткових занять на дозвіллі.

Це найяскравіше, що потрапляє в очі і залишається у пам’яті, хоча впевнений, що гурмани і естети зможуть розповісти про цю гру ще багато всього хорошого. А недоліків суттєвих не помічено, та й зовсім не хочеться їх шукати.
Зрештою, краще скуштувати і оцінити цю страву самому.

Аплодисменти і подяка розробникам!
One of the best games I've EVER played. A must-buy for any gamer.
